CAD switch: Presetting masks¶

Preset new list CAD2CDB

The presettings of mask attributes with metadata are configured for the CAD system MS-OUTLOOK by using this switch.

The value of this switch contains the presettings. The individual presettings are separated by a semicolon. The configuration of a presetting consists of a classification that indicates whether a presetting relates to a message or an attachment.

Possible classifications

0

The presetting relates to archiving the message.

1

The presetting relates to archiving each of the individual attachments.

2

The presetting relates to both archiving the message and archiving the individual associated attachments.

A colon and the actual presetting follow the classification. The individual presetting - from left to right - consists of the mask attribute to be preset, an equal sign and the value of the presetting. If a mask attribute is to be preset with a constant character string, this must be specified without quotation marks directly after the equal sign. When presetting a mask attribute with metadata for the message to be archived or for an attachment, the specification follows the equal sign in the form $(PROPERTY). The word PROPERTY must be replaced here with a valid label for a message or attachment attribute.

Message and attachment attributes

ATTACHFILENAME

File name of the respective attachment

BCC

Bcc (blind carbon copy)

CC

Cc (copy)

DELIVERYDATE

Reception date [2009-06-15]

DELIVERYDATETIME

Reception date/time[2009-06-15 12:40:55]

DELIVERYTIME

Reception time [12:40:55]

IMPORTANCE

Importance/priority of the e-mail [Low|Normal|High]

INTERNET_MESSAGE_ID

Unique ID, however, not always available (e.g. for drafts or in Exchange Cached Mode)

RECEIVEDBYNAME

Display name of the message recipient

RECIPIENT

Display name of the message recipients (To:)

RECIPIENT_MAIL

E-mail addresses of the message recipients (To:)

SENDER

Display name of the sender

SENDER_EMAIL

E-mail address of the sender

SENSITIVITY

Degree of sensitivity [Normal|Personal|Private|Confidential]

SUBJECT

Subject of the message

SUBMITDATE

Send date [2009-06-15]

SUBMITDATETIME

Send date/time [2009-06-15 12:40:55]

SUBMITTIME

Send time [12:40:55]

Possible configuration of the “Preset new list CAD2CDB” switch for Outlook

0:titel=$(SUBJECT);0:autoren=$(SENDER_EMAIL);0:z_categ1=Allgemeines;0:z_categ2=Korrespondenz; 1:titel=$(ATTACHFILENAME);1:src_fname=$(ATTACHFILENAME);2:src_rdate=$(DELIVERYDATE);
